definition: to recur (of events, esp. adverse ones)/to repeat (a performance)
to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act
to repeat an old stratagem/up to one's old tricks

sentences.english: This part faces the reality that history often repeats itself.
sentences.chinese: 这部分是关于直面历史不断重演的事实。

sentences.english: Many anxieties in Guadeloupe exist in France too.
sentences.chinese: 许多人焦虑瓜德罗普的事情在法国重演。

sentences.english: He re-acted the scene in his imagination.
sentences.chinese: 他在想像中重演了这一场面。

sentences.english: Clearly, recent economic history is not going to repeat itself.
sentences.chinese: 很明显，近期的经济史是不会重演的。
试着重演你早上睡觉醒来的姿势。

sentences.english: I will not let Ares' fate be my own.
sentences.chinese: 鲜血，我是不会让阿瑞斯的命运在我身上重演的。

sentences.english: One Edo period practice is particularly conspicuous across Japan at the beginning of this month.
sentences.chinese: 本月初在日本重演全国江户时代的做法特别令人瞩目。

sentences.english: How to avoid the tragedy repeating will testing various countries' wisdom and will.
sentences.chinese: 如何避免悲剧重演考验着各国的智慧和意志。

sentences.english: So it's almost history replaying itself over and over again, " he said.
sentences.chinese: 所以，情况几乎就是历史一次又一次地重演。

sentences.english: Military enthusiasts begin re-enacting Vietnam War.
sentences.chinese: 军事狂人重演越南战争游戏。

sentences.english: The company is now trying to pull off a similar trick with tea in the Middle East.
sentences.chinese: 现在，该公司又想在中东的茶叶市场上故伎重演。

sentences.english: As a personal trainer I see the same sad scenario repeat itself over and over.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个私人教练，我总是看到相同的悲剧重演。

sentences.english: We do not need to watch this tragedy again.
sentences.chinese: 我们不能眼看着这种悲剧重演。

sentences.english: Yet today the very same system that allowed this turmoil remains in place.
sentences.chinese: 然而，今天，这个同样系统人然会是悲剧重演。

sentences.english: Recent history of sedimentation is seen to be a recapitulation of the past.
sentences.chinese: 近代沉积史看来就是过去沉积史的重演。

sentences.english: But can we do as well as we did in 2008?
sentences.chinese: 但我们是否能重演2008年的出色表现呢？

definition: to follow the track of an overturned cart/to repeat a disastrous policy
to repeat/to follow the same road as
to screen (a movie)/to stage (a play)/a screening/a staging
lit. to return in a swirl of dust (idiom)/fig. to regroup and come back even stronger/to make a comeback
(literary) to be routed (in a war)/to suffer defeat (in sports etc)
wielding the halberd within the household (idiom); internecine strife
to learn a lesson from the mistakes of one's predecessor (idiom)
